intro: Barleriopsis discolor, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Barleriopsis discolor is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to drought conditions.
